card.name: Abuna's Chant
card.ability:
Choose one — You gain 5 life; or prevent the next 5 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.
Entwine {2} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

card.name: Acquire
card.ability: Search target opponent's library for an artifact card and put that card onto the battlefield under your control. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
card.flavor: Sometimes "innovation" means "stealing another's secret before anyone else can."

card.name: Advanced Hoverguard
card.ability:
Flying
{U}: Advanced Hoverguard gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
card.flavor:
"They are like their vedalken masters: untouchable, aloof, and omnipresent."
—Bruenna, Neurok leader

card.name: All Suns' Dawn
card.ability: For each color, return up to one target card of that color from your graveyard to your hand. Exile All Suns' Dawn.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : All Suns' Dawn can have from zero to five targets, one for each color.
12/1/2004 : You can target two blue-and-white multicolored cards by choosing one as the blue card and one as the white card.
12/1/2004 : You choose the color each target must be when you choose it as a target, so if the card you targeted as a blue card is red when All Suns' Dawn resolves, the card is an illegal target, even if the spell doesn't target another red card.

card.name: Anodet Lurker
card.ability: When Anodet Lurker dies, you gain 3 life.
card.flavor: These machines build fearsome visages out of scrap metal to scare off predators who would otherwise be eager to consume them.

card.name: Arachnoid
card.ability: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor: It follows the green sun over Mirrodin's surface, spinning massive webs of whispersilk as it goes.

card.name: Arcbound Wanderer
card.ability: Modular—Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : This card has modular--sunburst, a combination of two keyword abilities. The sunburst ability sets the number for the modular ability. Basically, the number of +1/+1 counters the Wanderer gets as it enters the battlefield is equal to the number of colors of mana used to pay its cost.
12/1/2004 : For the leaves-the-battlefield ability, the number of counters on Arcbound Wanderer at the time it left the battlefield is what's relevant; the number of colors of mana used to pay its cost doesn't matter anymore.
12/1/2004 : When the Wanderer leaves the battlefield, you may put the counters onto a single target artifact creature. You can't split them among two or more artifact creatures.
9/25/2006 : If an Arcbound creature gets enough -1/-1 counters to make its toughness 0 or cause the damage on it to now be lethal, the Modular ability will still give another artifact creature a number of +1/+1 counters equal to the number the Arcbound creature had before it got -1/-1 counters.

card.name: Armed Response
card.ability: Armed Response deals damage to target attacking creature equal to the number of Equipment you control.
card.flavor: Raksha watched as the goblins continued to pour onto the Razor Fields. "They just don't know when to stop, do they?"

card.name: Artificer's Intuition
card.ability: {U}, Discard an artifact card: Search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost 1 or less, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

card.name: Auriok Champion
card.ability:
Protection from black and from red
Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may gain 1 life.
card.flavor:
"Her will shall banish the shadows. Her might shall punish the lawless. Her beauty shall restore the light."
—Ushanti, leonin seer
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : Gaining life when a creature enters the battlefield is optional.

card.name: Auriok Salvagers
card.ability: {1}{W}: Return target artifact card with converted mana cost 1 or less from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: "Memnarch or the vedalken salvage most of the large machines, leaving us only scraps. Scraps are enough."

card.name: Auriok Windwalker
card.ability:
Flying
{T}: Attach target Equipment you control to target creature you control.
card.flavor: Each generation, a handful of Auriok girls are allowed to visit the Cave of Light. They return riding the wind and brandishing steel.

card.name: Avarice Totem
card.ability: {5}: Exchange control of Avarice Totem and target nonland permanent.
card.flavor: Souls and steel, the essence of Mirrodin. Memnarch lacks one but has an abundance of the other.
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : It is possible to activate this ability in response to itself and generate some odd combinations. For example, if you control this card and another permanent, you can use this card's ability and target the permanent you control. You can then use this card's ability again and target a permanent your opponent controls. The second usage resolves first and you get your opponent's permanent in exchange for this one. The first usage then resolves and swaps your other permanent for the Totem so you get it back. The net effect is that you can swap any non-land permanent you have for any of theirs if you can activate this ability twice. Note that your opponent does get the chance to use the Totem in between the resolutions of your two usages if they have the mana.

card.name: Baton of Courage
card.ability:
Flash
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a charge counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
Remove a charge counter from Baton of Courage: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

card.name: Battered Golem
card.ability:
Battered Golem doesn't untap during your untap step.
Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield, you may untap Battered Golem.
card.flavor: A dent marks every year of service, and it has as much rust as glory.

card.name: Beacon of Creation
card.ability: Put a 1/1 green Insect creature token onto the battlefield for each Forest you control. Shuffle Beacon of Creation into its owner's library.
card.flavor: A chorus of life heralds the arrival of Mirrodin's final sun.
card.ruling: 7/15/2007 : If a Beacon is countered, it’s put into its owner’s graveyard, not shuffled into the library.

card.name: Beacon of Destruction
card.ability: Beacon of Destruction deals 5 damage to target creature or player. Shuffle Beacon of Destruction into its owner's library.
card.flavor: The Great Furnace's blessing is a spectacular sight, but the best view comes at a high cost.
card.ruling: 7/15/2007 : If a Beacon is countered, it’s put into its owner’s graveyard, not shuffled into the library.

card.name: Beacon of Immortality
card.ability: Double target player's life total. Shuffle Beacon of Immortality into its owner's library.
card.flavor: The cave floods with light. A thousand rays shine forth and meld into one.
card.ruling:
2/1/2007 : If you double a negative life total, you do the real math.  A life total of -10 becomes -20.  
7/15/2007 : Beacon of Immortality's effect counts as life gain (or life loss, if the life total was negative) for effects that trigger on or replace life gain (or life loss).
7/15/2007 : If a Beacon is countered, it’s put into its owner’s graveyard, not shuffled into the library.

card.name: Beacon of Tomorrows
card.ability: Target player takes an extra turn after this one. Shuffle Beacon of Tomorrows into its owner's library.
card.flavor: To look into its light is to meet the gaze of history.
card.ruling: 7/15/2007 : If a Beacon is countered, it’s put into its owner’s graveyard, not shuffled into the library.

card.name: Beacon of Unrest
card.ability: Put target artifact or creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. Shuffle Beacon of Unrest into its owner's library.
card.flavor: A vertical scream pierces the night air and echoes doom through the clouds.
card.ruling: 7/15/2007 : If a Beacon is countered, it’s put into its owner’s graveyard, not shuffled into the library.

card.name: Blasting Station
card.ability:
{T}, Sacrifice a creature: Blasting Station deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, you may untap Blasting Station.

card.name: Blind Creeper
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a spell, Blind Creeper gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: It shuns everything except its next meal.
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : This ability triggers off anyone casting a spell, including you, not just Blind Creeper's controller or an opponent.

card.name: Blinkmoth Infusion
card.ability:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Untap all artifacts.
card.flavor: Power begets power.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : If you control no artifacts, Blinkmoth Infusion costs twelve generic mana and two blue mana to cast.
12/1/2004 : Blinkmoth Infusion untaps all artifacts on the battlefield, not just artifacts you control.

card.name: Bringer of the Black Dawn
card.ability:
You may pay {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} rather than pay Bringer of the Black Dawn's mana cost.
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay 2 life. If you do, search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.

card.name: Bringer of the Blue Dawn
card.ability:
You may pay {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} rather than pay Bringer of the Blue Dawn's mana cost.
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may draw two cards.

card.name: Bringer of the Green Dawn
card.ability:
You may pay {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} rather than pay Bringer of the Green Dawn's mana cost.
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a 3/3 green Beast creature token onto the battlefield.

card.name: Bringer of the Red Dawn
card.ability:
You may pay {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} rather than pay Bringer of the Red Dawn's mana cost.
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn.

card.name: Bringer of the White Dawn
card.ability:
You may pay {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} rather than pay Bringer of the White Dawn's mana cost.
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may return target artifact card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

card.name: Cackling Imp
card.ability:
Flying
{T}: Target player loses 1 life.
card.flavor: Its laughter drives needles through your mind.

card.name: Channel the Suns
card.ability: Add {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: To some the birth of the fifth sun was a sign of doom. To others it was a sign of salvation. But to all it was a sign.

card.name: Chimeric Coils
card.ability: {X}{1}: Chimeric Coils becomes an X/X Construct artifact creature. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.
card.flavor: The energy that infuses the rings with life also melts them away, leaving only useless puddles of slag.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : If X is 0, Chimeric Coils becomes a 0/0 creature and is put into its owner's graveyard.
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Circle of Protection: Artifacts
card.ability: {2}: The next time an artifact source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.flavor: "Memnarch shall rage against us. We shall endure."

card.name: Clearwater Goblet
card.ability:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a charge counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may gain life equal to the number of charge counters on Clearwater Goblet.

card.name: Clock of Omens
card.ability: Tap two untapped artifacts you control: Untap target artifact.
card.flavor: Those near the clock don't hear it anymore, but their every movement is in time with its ticking.

card.name: Composite Golem
card.ability: Sacrifice Composite Golem: Add {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: It binds the five suns in human form.

card.name: Condescend
card.ability:
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}.
Scry 2. (To scry 2, look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

card.name: Conjurer's Bauble
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Conjurer's Bauble: Put up to one target card from your graveyard on the bottom of your library. Draw a card.
card.flavor: It is the moment of discovery, the triumph of the mind, the reimagining of past glory.

card.name: Cosmic Larva
card.ability:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Cosmic Larva unless you sacrifice two lands.
card.flavor: For millennia they wandered from plane to plane, devouring all metal. Finally, their wanderings are over.

card.name: Cranial Plating
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.
{B}{B}: Attach Cranial Plating to target creature you control.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

card.name: Crucible of Worlds
card.ability: You may play land cards from your graveyard.
card.flavor: Amidst the darkest ashes grow the strongest seeds.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : Crucible of Worlds allows you to play land cards from your graveyard as well as from your hand.
12/1/2004 : Crucible of Worlds doesn't change the times when you can play those land cards. You can still play only one land per turn, and only during your main phase when you have priority and the stack is empty.
12/1/2004 : Crucible of Worlds doesn't allow you to activate activated abilities (such as cycling) of land cards in your graveyard.

card.name: Dawn's Reflection
card.ability:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds two mana in any combination of colors to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).
card.flavor: Only Sylvok magic could truly capture the perfection of a Mirrodin sunrise.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : The controller of the land gets the additional mana, not the controller of the enchantment.
12/1/2004 : The two mana can be of two different colors. The controller of the land chooses the colors.

card.name: Desecration Elemental
card.ability:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Whenever a player casts a spell, sacrifice a creature.
card.flavor: Its precious corpses dance like puppets to attract mindless nim prey.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : This ability triggers off anyone casting a spell, including you, not just Desecration Elemental's controller or an opponent.
12/1/2004 : If Desecration Elemental is the only creature you control when its triggered ability resolves, you'll have to sacrifice it.

card.name: Devour in Shadow
card.ability: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. You lose life equal to that creature's toughness.
card.flavor:
"Feel the burn of the mists. Master them. They will devour your enemies."
—Geth, keeper of the Vault

card.name: Disruption Aura
card.ability:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact has "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay its mana cost."
card.flavor: Vedalken weapons sold to outsiders are as dependable as the vedalken themselves.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : Mana cost includes any requirements for colored mana, although most artifacts don't have any color requirements.
12/1/2004 : If the enchanted artifact has X in its mana cost, X is 0.

card.name: Door to Nothingness
card.ability:
Door to Nothingness enters the battlefield tapped.
{W}{W}{U}{U}{B}{B}{R}{R}{G}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice Door to Nothingness: Target player loses the game.
card.flavor:
"All memory of your existence will be wiped from reality. You will die, and no one will mourn."
—Memnarch

card.name: Doubling Cube
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Double the amount of each type of mana in your mana pool.
card.flavor: The cube's surface is pockmarked with jagged runes that seem to shift when unobserved.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : Doubling Cube's ability is a mana ability.
12/1/2004 : The "type" of mana is its color, or lack thereof (if the mana is colorless).
12/1/2004 : Any restrictions on the mana in your mana pool aren't copied. For example, if you have {W}{W}{B}{5} with no restrictions on it in your mana pool and {U}{U}{U} that can be used only to cast artifact spells, you'll end up with {W}{W}{W}{W}{B}{B}{10}, {U}{U}{U} that can be used only to cast artifact spells, and {U}{U}{U} that can be used for anything.

card.name: Dross Crocodile
card.flavor: The necrogen may have taken its sight, but it can still taste the fear of its prey.

card.name: Early Frost
card.ability: Tap up to three target lands.
card.flavor: Under its mists, the earth sleeps.

card.name: Ebon Drake
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever a player casts a spell, you lose 1 life.
card.flavor: The deadliest killers serve only those who are not afraid to die.
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : This ability triggers off anyone casting a spell, including you, not just Ebon Drake's controller or an opponent.

card.name: Endless Whispers
card.ability: Each creature has "When this creature dies, choose target opponent. That player puts this card from its owner's graveyard onto the battlefield under his or her control at the beginning of the next end step."
card.flavor: Those who find death under the black sun's shadow cannot escape its pull.
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : The creatures have the triggered ability, so each creature's controller chooses one of his or her opponents to target.

card.name: Energy Chamber
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, choose one — Put a +1/+1 counter on target artifact creature; or put a charge counter on target noncreature artifact.

card.name: Engineered Explosives
card.ability:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a charge counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
{2}, Sacrifice Engineered Explosives: Destroy each nonland permanent with converted mana cost equal to the number of charge counters on Engineered Explosives.
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : If Engineered Explosives had no charge counters on it when you sacrificed it, it won't destroy an animated land, because that permanent is a land in addition to being a creature.

card.name: Ensouled Scimitar
card.ability:
{3}: Ensouled Scimitar becomes a 1/5 Spirit artifact creature with flying until end of turn. (Equipment that's a creature can't equip a creature.)
Equipped creature gets +1/+5.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Eon Hub
card.ability: Players skip their upkeep steps.
card.flavor: Its power source is time itself. It absorbs unused minutes and hours, bringing the end of existence always closer.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : The upkeep step is skipped entirely. The turn proceeds from untap step to draw step.
12/1/2004 : Upkeep-triggered abilities don't trigger, and "activate this ability only during your upkeep" abilities can't be activated.
12/1/2004 : Any triggered abilities that triggered during the untap step will go onto the stack at the start of the draw step.

card.name: Etched Oracle
card.ability:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
{1}, Remove four +1/+1 counters from Etched Oracle: Target player draws three cards.

card.name: Eternal Witness
card.ability: When Eternal Witness enters the battlefield, you may return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: She remembers every word spoken, from the hero's oath to the baby's cry.

card.name: Eyes of the Watcher
card.ability: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, scry 2. (To scry 2, look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : You do the scrying at the end of the ability's resolution (assuming you pay {1}).

card.name: Fangren Pathcutter
card.ability: Whenever Fangren Pathcutter attacks, attacking creatures gain trample until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Tracking a fangren pack is easy. Catching up to one is fatal."
—Viridian scout

card.name: Feedback Bolt
card.ability: Feedback Bolt deals damage to target player equal to the number of artifacts you control.
card.flavor: The path of least resistance is often through your enemies.

card.name: Ferocious Charge
card.ability:
Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
Scry 2. (To scry 2, look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

card.name: Ferropede
card.ability:
Ferropede is unblockable.
Whenever Ferropede deals combat damage to a player, you may remove a counter from target permanent.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : Any permanent is a legal target for Ferropede's last ability, not just one with a counter on it.
12/1/2004 : If there's more than one type of counter on the targeted permanent, Ferropede's controller chooses which counter to remove from it.

card.name: Fill with Fright
card.ability:
Target player discards two cards.
Scry 2. (To scry 2, look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

card.name: Fist of Suns
card.ability: You may pay {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} rather than pay the mana cost for spells that you cast.
card.flavor:
"It is all in my grasp. Every petty dream, every grand scheme, every soul, every fear. It all flows through me and from me."
—Memnarch
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : This is an alternative cost to cast a spell.
12/1/2004 : You can't pay more than one alternative cost for a spell. For example, you can't cast a spell using its flashback ability by paying {W}{U}{B}{R}{G}. Likewise, you can't pay {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} to cast a creature with morph face down.
12/1/2004 : Note that combining this card with Mycosynth Lattice from the Darksteel set means that all spells can be cast for five mana of any type (colored or colorless).

card.name: Fleshgrafter
card.ability: Discard an artifact card: Fleshgrafter gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Necrogen enflames certain emotional centers in the Morioks' brains: hate, aggression, and especially greed.

card.name: Fold into Æther
card.ability: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, its controller may put a creature card from his or her hand onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: Æther portals drift across Mirrodin's surface, dragging creatures across time and space.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : If the spell isn't countered (because it's a spell that can't be countered, for example), nothing happens.
12/1/2004 : If your Fold into AEther counters a spell you control, you get to put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.

card.name: Furnace Whelp
card.ability:
Flying
{R}: Furnace Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Baby dragons can't figure out humans—if they didn't want to be killed, why were they made of meat and treasure?

card.name: Gemstone Array
card.ability:
{2}: Put a charge counter on Gemstone Array.
Remove a charge counter from Gemstone Array: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Outside, it reflects the suns' light. Inside, it harvests the suns' power.

card.name: Goblin Brawler
card.ability:
First strike
Goblin Brawler can't be equipped.
card.flavor: Perhaps he shuns technology. Perhaps he appreciates nature. Perhaps he doesn't know the difference.
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : You can activate an equip ability that targets Goblin Brawler, but the Equipment will fail to move onto it.

card.name: Goblin Cannon
card.ability: {2}: Goblin Cannon deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Sacrifice Goblin Cannon.
card.flavor: Goblin cannon crews are known not for their aim but for their ability to dive for cover.
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : You can activate Goblin Cannon's ability multiple times in response to the first activation. Goblin Cannon will be sacrificed the first time the ability resolves, but each activation still deals damage when it resolves.

card.name: Grafted Wargear
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +3/+2.
Whenever Grafted Wargear becomes unattached from a permanent, sacrifice that permanent.
Equip {0} ({0}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : The "becomes unattached" ability triggers if (a) Grafted Wargear leaves the battlefield, (b) the equip ability moves it onto another creature, (c) another effect moves it onto another creature, (d) an effect causes it to become unattached, or (e) the creature leaves the battlefield.
12/1/2004 : Note that if (e) happens, the creature won't be on the battlefield to be sacrificed. In all cases, it's the creature that was equipped when the ability triggered that will be sacrificed.
12/1/2004 : If your Grafted Wargear somehow ends up on an opponent's creature and it then becomes unattached from that creature, you won't be able to sacrifice that creature because you don't control it.
4/15/2013 : You may activate this card's equip ability targeting the creature that it is currently attached to, even if it's the only creature you control. Since the equip ability costs zero, you can do this as many times as you like during your main phases, though it generally won't do anything.

card.name: Granulate
card.ability: Destroy each nonland artifact with converted mana cost 4 or less.
card.flavor: There aren't that many ways to destroy a solid steel weapon, but somehow the goblins keep finding new ones.

card.name: Grinding Station
card.ability:
{T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Target player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield, you may untap Grinding Station.

card.name: Guardian Idol
card.ability:
Guardian Idol enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{2}: Guardian Idol becomes a 2/2 Golem artifact creature until end of turn.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Healer's Headdress
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +0/+2 and has "{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn."
{W}{W}: Attach Healer's Headdress to target creature you control.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

card.name: Heliophial
card.ability:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a charge counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
{2}, Sacrifice Heliophial: Heliophial deals damage equal to the number of charge counters on it to target creature or player.

card.name: Helm of Kaldra
card.ability:
Equipped creature has first strike, trample, and haste.
{1}: If you control Equipment named Helm of Kaldra, Sword of Kaldra, and Shield of Kaldra, put a legendary 4/4 colorless Avatar creature token named Kaldra onto the battlefield and attach those Equipment to it.
Equip {2}
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : The token isn't put onto the battlefield unless you control all three Equipment when the ability resolves.
12/1/2004 : Helm of Kaldra is the third card in the Kaldra cycle. Sword of Kaldra was in the Mirrodin set. Shield of Kaldra was in the Darksteel set.
12/1/2004 : The token is named "Kaldra," has the Supertype "Legendary," and has creature type "Avatar."This is different from previous creature tokens, where the name and creature type were the same.

card.name: Horned Helm
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1 and has trample.
{G}{G}: Attach Horned Helm to target creature you control.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

card.name: Hoverguard Sweepers
card.ability:
Flying
When Hoverguard Sweepers enters the battlefield, you may return up to two target creatures to their owners' hands.
card.flavor: They only appear in emergencies, and emergencies never last long.

card.name: Infused Arrows
card.ability:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a charge counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
{T}, Remove X charge counters from Infused Arrows: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn.

card.name: Into Thin Air
card.ability:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Return target artifact to its owner's hand.
card.flavor:
"Perhaps I should take Mirrodin apart and begin again."
—Memnarch

card.name: Ion Storm
card.ability: {1}{R}, Remove a +1/+1 counter or a charge counter from a permanent you control: Ion Storm deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: When enough artifacts lie too long in the same place, their magical radiation weakens reality, opening rifts of unpredictable destructive power.

card.name: Iron-Barb Hellion
card.ability:
Haste
Iron-Barb Hellion can't block.
card.flavor: When you feel a rumble in the ground, hold perfectly still. One sound will bring the hellion.

card.name: Joiner Adept
card.ability: Lands you control have "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."
card.flavor: A talented apprentice makes all things. The master makes all things possible.
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : Each land you control gets this ability.

card.name: Krark-Clan Engineers
card.ability: {R}, Sacrifice two artifacts: Destroy target artifact.
card.flavor: "Well, I jammed the whatsit into the whackdoodle, but I think I broke the thingamajigger."

card.name: Krark-Clan Ironworks
card.ability: Sacrifice an artifact: Add {2} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: All the junk, refuse, and offal of the Krark Clan is diligently collected, melted down, and made into more junk, refuse, and offal.

card.name: Krark-Clan Ogre
card.ability: {R}, Sacrifice an artifact: Target creature can't block this turn.
card.flavor: The Krark Clan believes it's caught an ogre. The ogre believes he's caught seven goblins.

card.name: Lantern of Insight
card.ability:
Players play with the top card of their libraries revealed.
{T}, Sacrifice Lantern of Insight: Target player shuffles his or her library.
card.flavor: Each eye sees a different possibility for tomorrow.
card.ruling:
4/15/2013 : The top card of your library isn't in your hand, so you can't suspend it, cycle it, discard it, or activate any of its activated abilities.
4/15/2013 : If the top card of your library is a land, you can play it if you could play a land.
4/15/2013 : If the top card of your library changes while you're casting a spell or activating an ability, the new top card won't be revealed until you finish casting that spell or activating that ability.
4/15/2013 : When playing with the top card of your library revealed, if an effect tells you to draw several cards, reveal each one before you draw it.

card.name: Leonin Squire
card.ability: When Leonin Squire enters the battlefield, return target artifact card with converted mana cost 1 or less from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor:
"I may be kha, but without my soldiers, my people, I am nothing."
—Raksha Golden Cub

card.name: Lose Hope
card.ability:
Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Scry 2. (To scry 2, look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

card.name: Loxodon Anchorite
card.ability: {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
card.flavor: The loxodon ascribe religious superiority to those born albino, believing them to be spiritually pure.

card.name: Loxodon Stalwart
card.ability:
Vigilance
{W}: Loxodon Stalwart gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Long ago, the Auriok attempted peace with the loxodons. The leonin attempted war. Neither succeeded.

card.name: Lunar Avenger
card.ability:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
Remove a +1/+1 counter from Lunar Avenger: Lunar Avenger gains your choice of flying, first strike, or haste until end of turn.
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : You choose whether Lunar Avenger gains flying, first strike, or haste when the activated ability resolves.

card.name: Magma Giant
card.ability: When Magma Giant enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.
card.flavor: Its open mouth is a furnace blast that blisters the skin. Its smoking fists are meteors that split the earth.

card.name: Magma Jet
card.ability:
Magma Jet deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
Scry 2. (To scry 2, look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

card.name: Magnetic Theft
card.ability: Attach target Equipment to target creature. (Control of the Equipment doesn't change.)
card.flavor: Among the Vulshok, the most prized blades are those that killed their original owners.
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : Magnetic Theft can cause an Equipment one player controls to be attached to a creature another player controls. The controller of the Equipment can pay the equip cost to move the Equipment to a creature he or she controls (but only any time that player could cast a Sorcery).

card.name: Mana Geyser
card.ability: Add {R} to your mana pool for each tapped land your opponents control.
card.flavor: The Quicksilver Sea hissed and bubbled at the indignity. The Vulshok shaman just smiled.

card.name: Mephidross Vampire
card.ability:
Flying
Each creature you control is a Vampire in addition to its other creature types and has "Whenever this creature deals damage to a creature, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature."
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : The triggered ability Mephidross Vampire grants to each creature you control triggers on any damage dealt to any creature, not just combat damage.

card.name: Moriok Rigger
card.ability: Whenever an artifact is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Moriok Rigger.
card.flavor: The Moriok scavenge for weapons, for armor, for food—and ultimately for their souls.

card.name: Mycosynth Golem
card.ability:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Artifact creature spells you cast have affinity for artifacts. (They cost {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : The spells gain affinity for artifacts as they're put onto the stack. They don't have the ability while they're cards in your hand.
12/1/2004 : If Mycosynth Golem is sacrificed as part of the cost to cast a spell, the cost reduction will already be locked in, and the cost won't be increased.
12/1/2004 : Two or more instances of the affinity ability are cumulative, even if they're both affinity for the same thing.

card.name: Myr Quadropod
card.ability: {3}: Switch Myr Quadropod's power and toughness until end of turn.
card.flavor: Each myr was designed to fill a specific role. This one, for example, was designed to stomp on other myr.
card.ruling:
4/15/2013 : Effects that switch power and toughness apply after all other effects that change power and/or toughness, regardless of which effect was created first.
4/15/2013 : Switching a creature’s power and toughness twice (or any even number of times) effectively returns the creature to the power and toughness it had before any switches.

card.name: Myr Servitor
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, if Myr Servitor is on the battlefield, each player returns all cards named Myr Servitor from his or her graveyard to the battlefield.
card.flavor: The Krark Clan enjoys pulling them apart just to watch them reassemble one another.
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : The Myr Servitor that's the source of the ability must be on the battlefield when the ability resolves. If it is, all other Myr Servitor cards are returned from all graveyards to the battlefield under their owner's control. If it's not, no Myr Servitors are returned to the battlefield.

card.name: Neurok Stealthsuit
card.ability:
Equipped creature has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
{U}{U}: Attach Neurok Stealthsuit to target creature you control.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

card.name: Night's Whisper
card.ability: You draw two cards and you lose 2 life.
card.flavor: The Moriok call the black moon the Whisperer. At her apex, she whispers of power.

card.name: Nim Grotesque
card.ability: Nim Grotesque gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.
card.flavor: In the swirling mists, you could walk right up to one and not know until its teeth are in your throat.

card.name: Opaline Bracers
card.ability:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a charge counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
Equipped creature gets +X/+X, where X is the number of charge counters on Opaline Bracers.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

card.name: Ouphe Vandals
card.ability: {G}, Sacrifice Ouphe Vandals: Counter target activated ability from an artifact source and destroy that artifact if it's on the battlefield. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)
card.flavor: The ouphes finally managed to still the clockwork monstrosity by catching themselves in its cogs.
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : The ability targets an ability on the stack, not the artifact, so it can destroy an artifact with protection from green or one that can't be targeted by spells and abilities.

card.name: Paradise Mantle
card.ability:
Equipped creature has "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

card.name: Pentad Prism
card.ability:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a charge counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
Remove a charge counter from Pentad Prism: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Plasma Elemental
card.ability: Plasma Elemental is unblockable.
card.flavor:
"I watched a ship sail right through it. I thought it was harmless . . . until I saw what it had done to the crew."
—Bruenna, Neurok leader

card.name: Plunge into Darkness
card.ability:
Choose one — Sacrifice any number of creatures, then you gain 3 life for each sacrificed creature; or pay X life, then look at the top X cards of your library, put one of those cards into your hand, and exile the rest.
Entwine {B} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : Everything other than the mode/entwine choice (and paying the {1}{B}, of course) is done on resolution.
12/1/2004 : Assuming the entwine cost has been paid, the effect is (1) sacrifice any number of creatures, (2) gain 3 life for each sacrificed creature, (3) choose X, (4) pay X life, and (5) look at the top X cards of your library, put one into your hand, and exile the rest.

card.name: Possessed Portal
card.ability:
If a player would draw a card, that player skips that draw instead.
At the beginning of each end step, each player sacrifices a permanent unless he or she discards a card.

card.name: Qumulox
card.ability:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Flying
card.flavor: Even the clouds bend themselves to Memnarch's will, eager to swallow those who oppose him.

card.name: Rain of Rust
card.ability:
Choose one — Destroy target artifact; or destroy target land.
Entwine {3}{R} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
card.flavor: On Mirrodin, mages who call upon the power of rust are shunned by their people and often turn mercenary to survive.

card.name: Raksha Golden Cub
card.ability:
Vigilance
As long as Raksha Golden Cub is equipped, Cat creatures you control get +2/+2 and have double strike.
card.flavor: Some believe that Raksha, youngest of the kha, is the reincarnation of Dakan, the first and mightiest of leonin leaders.
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : Raksha Golden Cub is a Cat, so it also gets +2/+2 and double strike if it's equipped.

card.name: Razorgrass Screen
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Razorgrass Screen blocks each turn if able.
card.flavor: Hand-stitched, and marked by the blood of the Auriok.

card.name: Razormane Masticore
card.ability:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Razormane Masticore unless you discard a card.
At the beginning of your draw step, you may have Razormane Masticore deal 3 damage to target creature.

card.name: Relentless Rats
card.ability:
Relentless Rats gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield named Relentless Rats.
A deck can have any number of cards named Relentless Rats.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : Yes, you're allowed to have a deck consisting of sixty Relentless Rats and nothing else.
12/1/2004 : Relentless Rats's last ability overrides the normal limit of four of an individual card in a Constructed deck.

card.name: Relic Barrier
card.ability: {T}: Tap target artifact.
card.flavor: Its transmissions are the word of Memnarch. It speaks, and metal bows.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Can target a tapped artifact.

card.name: Retaliate
card.ability: Destroy all creatures that dealt damage to you this turn.
card.flavor: The Auriok learned perseverance from their forebears. They learned justice from the leonin.

card.name: Reversal of Fortune
card.ability: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You may copy an instant or sorcery card in it. If you do, you may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.
card.flavor: "Why learn hundreds of spells when you can learn only one and use it to steal hundreds?"
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : Reversal of Fortune creates a copy of the card in the other player's hand, then allows you to cast the copy from that player's hand without paying its mana cost.
12/1/2004 : You cast the copy while this ability is resolving and still on the stack. Normally, you're not allowed to cast spells or activate abilities at this time. Reversal of Fortune provides an exception.
12/1/2004 : You don't pay the spell's mana cost. If the spell has X in its mana cost, X is 0. You do pay any additional costs for that spell. You can't use any alternative costs.
12/1/2004 : If the copied card is a split card, you may choose to cast either side of the split card but not both.
12/1/2004 : You can't cast the copy if an effect prevents you from casting Instants or sorceries, or from casting that particular Instant or Sorcery. It doesn't matter whether your opponent can cast the card at this time; the only thing that matters is whether you can cast it.
12/1/2004 : You can't cast the copy unless all of its targets, if any, can be chosen.
12/1/2004 : If you don't want to cast the copy, you can choose not to; the copy ceases to exist the next time state-based actions are checked.
12/1/2004 : The spell is cast from your opponent's hand, not yours, which can be important for some cards.
3/1/2005 : The creation of the copy and then the casting of the copy are both optional.

card.name: Rite of Passage
card.ability: Whenever a creature you control is dealt damage, put a +1/+1 counter on it. (The damage is dealt before the counter is put on.)
card.flavor: Every scar is a lesson, every battle a test of what you have learned.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : If the creature is dealt damage by more than one source at the same time, it gets only one counter.
12/1/2004 : The creature doesn't get a counter if all the damage that would be dealt to it is prevented.

card.name: Roar of Reclamation
card.ability: Each player returns all artifact cards from his or her graveyard to the battlefield.
card.flavor:
"Yesterday's relics will determine the outcome of tomorrow's war."
—Ushanti, leonin seer

card.name: Rude Awakening
card.ability:
Choose one — Untap all lands you control; or until end of turn, lands you control become 2/2 creatures that are still lands.
Entwine {2}{G} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Salvaging Station
card.ability:
{T}: Return target noncreature artifact card with converted mana cost 1 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
Whenever a creature dies, you may untap Salvaging Station.

card.name: Sawtooth Thresher
card.ability:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
Remove two +1/+1 counters from Sawtooth Thresher: Sawtooth Thresher gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

card.name: Screaming Fury
card.ability: Target creature gets +5/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.
card.flavor: He's got an axe to grind.

card.name: Serum Visions
card.ability:
Draw a card.
Scry 2. (To scry 2, look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

card.name: Shattered Dreams
card.ability: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose an artifact card from it. That player discards that card.
card.flavor: Victims are lucky if they remember ever having had what was lost.

card.name: Silent Arbiter
card.ability:
No more than one creature can attack each combat.
No more than one creature can block each combat.
card.flavor: Scholars say that arbiters exist on every world, created by an unknown hand to enforce justice.

card.name: Skullcage
card.ability: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, Skullcage deals 2 damage to that player unless he or she has exactly three or exactly four cards in hand.
card.flavor: Only a focused mind can survive it.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : Skullcage's ability deals damage if the player has zero, one, two, five, or more than five cards in hand when its ability resolves.
12/1/2004 : Skullcage doesn't check hand size when it triggers, only when it resolves.

card.name: Skyhunter Prowler
card.ability: Flying, vigilance (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach, and attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
card.flavor:
"If what I have seen comes to pass, we will need our guardians more than ever."
—Ushanti, leonin seer

card.name: Skyhunter Skirmisher
card.ability: Flying, double strike (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach, and it deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
card.flavor:
"Like dawn's first light, blind the unprepared and banish the shadows."
—Skyhunter creed

card.name: Skyreach Manta
card.ability:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
Flying
card.flavor: As the dawns break, the manta soars.

card.name: Solarion
card.ability:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
{T}: Double the number of +1/+1 counters on Solarion.
card.ruling: 12/1/2004 : "Double" has its normal English meaning. If Solarion had three +1/+1 counters on it, it would end up with six +1/+1 counters on it.

card.name: Spark Elemental
card.ability:
Trample, haste (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker. This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Spark Elemental.
card.flavor: Vulshok shamans summon spark elementals to burn paths through thick underbrush—or through goblin salvage squads.

card.name: Sparring Collar
card.ability:
Equipped creature has first strike.
{R}{R}: Attach Sparring Collar to target creature you control.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

card.name: Spectral Shift
card.ability:
Choose one — Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one basic land type with another; or change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another. (These effects last indefinitely.)
Entwine {2} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
card.ruling: 4/1/2005 : Because of updated targeting rulings, it's possible to target the same spell or permanent with both abilities when cast with Entwine.

card.name: Spinal Parasite
card.ability:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
Remove two +1/+1 counters from Spinal Parasite: Remove a counter from target permanent.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : Yes, this card's base power/toughness is -1/-1. If it has five +1/+1 counters on it, it's a 4/4 creature.
12/1/2004 : If Spinal Parasite is a 1/1 because it has two +1/+1 counters on it, you can remove both counters to pay for its activated ability.
12/1/2004 : Any permanent is a legal target for Spinal Parasite's ability, not just one with a counter on it. The player who controls Spinal Parasite chooses which counter to remove from the targeted permanent.

card.name: Staff of Domination
card.ability:
{1}: Untap Staff of Domination.
{2}, {T}: You gain 1 life.
{3}, {T}: Untap target creature.
{4}, {T}: Tap target creature.
{5}, {T}: Draw a card.

card.name: Stand Firm
card.ability:
Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Scry 2. (To scry 2, look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

card.name: Stasis Cocoon
card.ability:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact's activated abilities can't be activated. If enchanted artifact is a creature, it can't attack or block.
card.flavor: Though the grip of a golem is strong, the grip of Auriok magic is far stronger.

card.name: Steelshaper's Gift
card.ability: Search your library for an Equipment card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Some blades seek their own wielders.

card.name: Summoner's Egg
card.ability:
Imprint — When Summoner's Egg enters the battlefield, you may exile a card from your hand face down.
When Summoner's Egg dies, turn the exiled card face up. If it's a creature card, put it onto the battlefield under your control.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : The card is imprinted face down. This means that other players don't know what the card is and you can't look at the card once it's imprinted (until it's turned face up, of course). Note that effects that exile cards, including all previous imprint cards, exile those cards face up unless the effect says otherwise.
12/1/2004 : If the card is not a creature card when it's turned face up, it remains exiled face up.
12/1/2004 : Any "When this creature is turned face up" abilities that the exiled card may have don't trigger because the card isn't being turned face up while it's on the battlefield.

card.name: Summoning Station
card.ability:
{T}: Put a 2/2 colorless Pincher creature token onto the battlefield.
Whenever an artifact is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may untap Summoning Station.

card.name: Suncrusher
card.ability:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
{4}, {T}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Suncrusher: Destroy target creature.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Suncrusher: Return Suncrusher to its owner's hand.

card.name: Suntouched Myr
card.ability: Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
card.flavor: As the fifth sun joins the other four, new abilities awaken in the creatures of Mirrodin.

card.name: Sylvok Explorer
card.ability: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.
card.flavor: Any creature on a druid's shoulder is his family, any land under his feet his home.

card.name: Synod Centurion
card.ability: When you control no other artifacts, sacrifice Synod Centurion.
card.flavor:
"We order them to stand, they stand. We order them to wait, they wait. We order them to die, they die."
—Pontifex, elder researcher

card.name: Tangle Asp
card.ability: Whenever Tangle Asp blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
card.flavor:
"I have no fangs, yet I constantly bite. I have no scales, yet I slither through you. What am I?"
—Riddle of the viper's venom

card.name: Tel-Jilad Justice
card.ability:
Destroy target artifact.
Scry 2. (To scry 2, look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

card.name: Tel-Jilad Lifebreather
card.ability: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice a Forest: Regenerate target creature.
card.flavor: "The Tangle loans you life. Spend it well."

card.name: Thermal Navigator
card.ability: Sacrifice an artifact: Thermal Navigator gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: It takes off with a roar of superheated wind, startling wild pterons as they survey the ground below.

card.name: Thought Courier
card.ability: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
card.flavor: It is telling of the vedalkens' culture that they trust human couriers more than their own comrades.

card.name: Tornado Elemental
card.ability:
When Tornado Elemental enters the battlefield, it deals 6 damage to each creature with flying.
You may have Tornado Elemental assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.
4/1/2008 : When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
4/1/2008 : You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
4/1/2008 : If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

card.name: Trinket Mage
card.ability: When Trinket Mage enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost 1 or less, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
card.ruling: 1/1/2011 : If the mana cost of a card in your library includes {X}, X is considered to be 0.

card.name: Tyrranax
card.ability: {1}{G}: Tyrranax gets -1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: It outnumbers you one to many.

card.name: Vanquish
card.ability: Destroy target blocking creature.
card.flavor:
"All beings have an inner light. Let me show you yours."
—Ushanti, leonin seer

card.name: Vedalken Mastermind
card.ability: {U}, {T}: Return target permanent you control to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: The vedalken see other beings from a cold distance, as either experimental subjects or objects of study.

card.name: Vedalken Orrery
card.ability: You may cast nonland cards as though they had flash.
card.flavor: The model incorporated the fifth sun effortlessly, as if it had always known.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : The controller of Vedalken Orrery can cast nonland artifact, creature, enchantment, and Sorcery cards any time he or she could cast an Instant. This includes on other players' turns and during the upkeep step, draw step, combat phase, and end step.
6/15/2010 : This applies only to casting spells. It does not, for example, change when you may activate abilities that can only be activated "any time you could cast a sorcery".

card.name: Vedalken Shackles
card.ability:
You may choose not to untap Vedalken Shackles during your untap step.
{2}, {T}: Gain control of target creature with power less than or equal to the number of Islands you control for as long as Vedalken Shackles remains tapped.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : The creature's power and the number of Islands you control matter only when the ability is activated and resolved. After that, only the fact that Vedalken Shackles remains tapped matters.  You maintain control even if it stops being a creature.
12/1/2004 : If Vedalken Shackles becomes untapped before its ability resolves, you don't gain control of the creature, even for a second.
12/1/2004 : If Vedalken Shackles leaves the battlefield, it's no longer tapped, so you lose control of the creature.

card.name: Vicious Betrayal
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Vicious Betrayal, sacrifice any number of creatures.
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature sacrificed this way.

card.name: Viridian Lorebearers
card.ability: {3}{G}, {T}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of artifacts your opponents control.
card.flavor: A small band of elves pledged many years ago to avoid the Edges of Forgetting. They have remained hidden until now.

card.name: Viridian Scout
card.ability: {2}{G}, Sacrifice Viridian Scout: Viridian Scout deals 2 damage to target creature with flying.
card.flavor: They know a hoverguard's only blind spot is directly above it.

card.name: Vulshok Sorcerer
card.ability:
Haste
{T}: Vulshok Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Vulshok sorcerers train by leaping into electrified storm clouds. Dead or alive, they come back down with smiles on their faces.

card.name: Wayfarer's Bauble
card.ability: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Wayfarer's Bauble: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: It is the forest beyond the horizon, the mountain waiting to be climbed, the new land across the endless sea.
